name: QQbubu
more-info: As an experienced developer with 7 years of experience, I am a full-stack engineer who can provide one-stop support from design, design, coding, testing, and maintenance.  'Your reliable partner, dream website!' is our motto.
about-text-top: I became a web engineer when I was in college, when I became interested in web service development and started learning HTML and CSS on my own.  Later, I began to learn this field in earnest when a website I created for myself as a hobby was well received by people around me and I was fascinated by the ever-evolving development of web technology. After working for a company, I am now working as a freelancer. I have learned that it is important to keep learning amidst the fast pace of technological innovation. In addition to the skills I have honed through self-study, I aim to be an engineer who can flexibly respond to the needs of each individual client while always checking the latest trends. I hope to continue to grow with the development of technology.
about-text-bottom: Outside of the coding world, I enjoy traveling and learning foreign languages. I also enjoy playing games, DJing, pencil drawing as a hobby, and practicing piano in my free time.

projects.description: A search application that utilizes the moogle API to search for Final Fantasy characters; users can search for the games and characters from the main series.

A 'task manager' or todo application built with React. Users can add, delete, edit, and view their tasks. I've also included drag and drop functionality to reorder tasks, a mark as complete option, and a dark/light theme toggler.

An application based on the traditional game with two extra player choices originating from 'The Big Bang Theory'. Users can play against a computer on their mobile device or desktop and try to get a high score.
A thematic and responsive calculator that allows users to easily add, subtract, and divide positive integers and floating point numbers.
A web application I made with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for a friend to help him connect fiber internet at work more efficiently.
A mobile responsive landing page for a fictional messaging company called 'Huddle'.
A mobile-responsive app that allows users to get random pieces of advice with the click of a button.
This is a browser art pad inspired by the mechanical drawing toy, Etch A Sketch. I named it 'Etch-A-Glow' because users can use glowing squares to sketch their designs.

This is an interactive map application I developed using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Users can record their adventures and details such as how much it cost, when it happened, and the duration for future reference.
A fully responsive web page for a fictional luxury hotel company called 'Nexter'.
